intro: Tapinanthus henriquesii, commonly known as the Henriques' dodder, is a parasitic flowering plant that lacks chlorophyll and relies entirely on its host for nutrients. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its yellow, thread-like stems that缠绕 (twine) around host plants. The plant produces small, white or yellow flowers and has a short life cycle, typically completing its development within a few months. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found growing on various shrubs and trees. Due to its parasitic nature, it can significantly affect the growth and survival of its host plants.
